text: Aboulomania has ruined my lifeThis is basically the term for pathological indecisiveness  And it defines me perfectly  I can t stress enough how debilitating it has been for me to make big decisions over the years  I ll be stuck in analysis paralysis for days and never make any progress  I started a business years ago because I couldn t decide on a career and still question every day if this is what I should be doing  I m grateful it has made me a living but i ve put such little effort in to it  it has made me feel unemployed at times  It s like I have no inner voice or spirit guiding me telling what s the right thing to do  And even when I do finally make a decision I will ALWAYS beat the crap out of myself because I ll tell myself it was the wrong one  And I ll question everything I m doing all the time  I never have any sense of security or closure on any decision  I ll then spend a ridiculous amount of time dwelling on past decisions and imagining what my life could be like if I had made better choices  Can anyone relate  Could this be a sign of another underlying disorder  I believe if I could get this under control I would not be depressed and might actually want to live
summary: Aboulomania is a disorder of pathological indecisiveness. It's been debilitating for me to make big decisions over the years. I started a business years ago because I couldn't decide on a career and still question every day if this is what I should be doing.

text: I ll stick around to do what I promised  but after that I ll goI have half a mind to go now  but I have to finish what I started  can t just leave her alone I ve already decided  not backing out this time  I m tired of being afraid to let go  Nights terrify me  I m really sorry  I can t see much to hang on for anymore  I couldn t be saved  nor do I want to anymore  I lived a victim of myself  I tried sobriety and all I realized is I m too sober to be observing this depressing comedy of errors while maintaining the sanity of my indecisively indecisive wreck of a self  My days are blurry  it s a wonder I make it out of bed  I haven t seen much in a while  I don t see color  I don t feel laughter  I feel sadness  but it s more in a state of perpetual hopeless panic  I wish you could see what I see  at least I wouldn t feel so guilty  I lived and loved and laughed and cried  and I ve run out of energy trying anymore  I m a selfish coward  I hope everyone I knew knows their worth to me  I hope you find it in you to see past the grief  that I ll be at rest from myself  I want to go a lot more than I want to wake up again  I loved every single one of you  I wish it weren t so  it would ve made it easier  Your memories are the only emotions to ever paint my gray existence  even if only briefly  You mean a lot more to me than I ever showed  I ll go thinking about all of you  I hope that when I go  you wouldn t resent me  As the song goes  Leave Out All the Rest Love
